spec.description: Configuration affecting label/content routing, sni routing, etc. See more details at: https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/networking/virtual-service.html

exportTo.description: A list of namespaces to which this virtual service is exported.

gateways.description: The names of gateways and sidecars that should apply these routes.

hosts.description: The destination hosts to which traffic is being sent.

http.description: An ordered list of route rules for HTTP traffic.

allowCredentials.description: Indicates whether the caller is allowed to send the actual request (not the preflight) using credentials.

allowHeaders.description: List of HTTP headers that can be used when requesting the resource.

allowMethods.description: List of HTTP methods allowed to access the resource.

allowOrigins.description: String patterns that match allowed origins.

exposeHeaders.description: A list of HTTP headers that the browsers are allowed to access.

maxAge.description: Specifies how long the results of a preflight request can be cached.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

unmatchedPreflights.description:
Indicates whether preflight requests not matching the configured allowed origin shouldn't be forwarded to the upstream.

Valid Options: FORWARD, IGNORE

delegate.description: Delegate is used to specify the particular VirtualService which can be used to define delegate HTTPRoute.

name.description: Name specifies the name of the delegate VirtualService.

namespace.description: Namespace specifies the namespace where the delegate VirtualService resides.

directResponse.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

body.description: Specifies the content of the response body.

bytes.description: response body as base64 encoded bytes.

status.description: Specifies the HTTP response status to be returned.

fault.description: Fault injection policy to apply on HTTP traffic at the client side.

abort.description: Abort Http request attempts and return error codes back to downstream service, giving the impression that the upstream service is faulty.

grpcStatus.description: GRPC status code to use to abort the request.

httpStatus.description: HTTP status code to use to abort the Http request.

percentage.description: Percentage of requests to be aborted with the error code provided.

delay.description: Delay requests before forwarding, emulating various failures such as network issues, overloaded upstream service, etc.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

fixedDelay.description: Add a fixed delay before forwarding the request.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

percent.description: Percentage of requests on which the delay will be injected (0-100).

percentage.description: Percentage of requests on which the delay will be injected.

match.description: Match conditions to be satisfied for the rule to be activated.

authority.description: HTTP Authority values are case-sensitive and formatted as follows: - `exact: "value"` for exact string match - `prefix: "value"` for prefix-based match - `regex: "value"` for [RE2 style regex-based match](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).

gateways.description: Names of gateways where the rule should be applied.

headers.description: The header keys must be lowercase and use hyphen as the separator, e.g.

ignoreUriCase.description: Flag to specify whether the URI matching should be case-insensitive.

method.description: HTTP Method values are case-sensitive and formatted as follows: - `exact: "value"` for exact string match - `prefix: "value"` for prefix-based match - `regex: "value"` for [RE2 style regex-based match](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).

name.description: The name assigned to a match.

port.description: Specifies the ports on the host that is being addressed.

scheme.description: URI Scheme values are case-sensitive and formatted as follows: - `exact: "value"` for exact string match - `prefix: "value"` for prefix-based match - `regex: "value"` for [RE2 style regex-based match](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).

sourceLabels.description: One or more labels that constrain the applicability of a rule to source (client) workloads with the given labels.

sourceNamespace.description: Source namespace constraining the applicability of a rule to workloads in that namespace.

statPrefix.description: The human readable prefix to use when emitting statistics for this route.

uri.description: URI to match values are case-sensitive and formatted as follows: - `exact: "value"` for exact string match - `prefix: "value"` for prefix-based match - `regex: "value"` for [RE2 style regex-based match](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).

withoutHeaders.description: withoutHeader has the same syntax with the header, but has opposite meaning.

mirror.description: Mirror HTTP traffic to a another destination in addition to forwarding the requests to the intended destination.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

mirrorPercentage.description: Percentage of the traffic to be mirrored by the `mirror` field.

mirrors.description: Specifies the destinations to mirror HTTP traffic in addition to the original destination.

destination.description: Destination specifies the target of the mirror operation.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

percentage.description: Percentage of the traffic to be mirrored by the `destination` field.

name.description: The name assigned to the route for debugging purposes.

redirect.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

authority.description: On a redirect, overwrite the Authority/Host portion of the URL with this value.

derivePort.description:
On a redirect, dynamically set the port: * FROM_PROTOCOL_DEFAULT: automatically set to 80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS.

Valid Options: FROM_PROTOCOL_DEFAULT, FROM_REQUEST_PORT

port.description: On a redirect, overwrite the port portion of the URL with this value.

redirectCode.description: On a redirect, Specifies the HTTP status code to use in the redirect response.

scheme.description: On a redirect, overwrite the scheme portion of the URL with this value.

uri.description: On a redirect, overwrite the Path portion of the URL with this value.

attempts.description: Number of retries to be allowed for a given request.

backoff.description: Specifies the minimum duration between retry attempts.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

perTryTimeout.description: Timeout per attempt for a given request, including the initial call and any retries.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

retryIgnorePreviousHosts.description: Flag to specify whether the retries should ignore previously tried hosts during retry.

retryOn.description: Specifies the conditions under which retry takes place.

retryRemoteLocalities.description: Flag to specify whether the retries should retry to other localities.

rewrite.description: Rewrite HTTP URIs and Authority headers.

authority.description: rewrite the Authority/Host header with this value.

uri.description: rewrite the path (or the prefix) portion of the URI with this value.

uriRegexRewrite.description: rewrite the path portion of the URI with the specified regex.

rewrite.description: The string that should replace into matching portions of original URI.

route.description: A HTTP rule can either return a direct_response, redirect or forward (default) traffic.

destination.description: Destination uniquely identifies the instances of a service to which the request/connection should be forwarded to.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

weight.description: Weight specifies the relative proportion of traffic to be forwarded to the destination.

timeout.description: Timeout for HTTP requests, default is disabled.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: must be a valid duration greater than 1ms

tcp.description: An ordered list of route rules for opaque TCP traffic.

match.description: Match conditions to be satisfied for the rule to be activated.

destinationSubnets.description: IPv4 or IPv6 ip addresses of destination with optional subnet.

gateways.description: Names of gateways where the rule should be applied.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

sourceLabels.description: One or more labels that constrain the applicability of a rule to workloads with the given labels.

sourceNamespace.description: Source namespace constraining the applicability of a rule to workloads in that namespace.

route.description: The destination to which the connection should be forwarded to.

destination.description: Destination uniquely identifies the instances of a service to which the request/connection should be forwarded to.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

weight.description: Weight specifies the relative proportion of traffic to be forwarded to the destination.

tls.description: An ordered list of route rule for non-terminated TLS & HTTPS traffic.

match.description: Match conditions to be satisfied for the rule to be activated.

destinationSubnets.description: IPv4 or IPv6 ip addresses of destination with optional subnet.

gateways.description: Names of gateways where the rule should be applied.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

sniHosts.description: SNI (server name indicator) to match on.

sourceLabels.description: One or more labels that constrain the applicability of a rule to workloads with the given labels.

sourceNamespace.description: Source namespace constraining the applicability of a rule to workloads in that namespace.

route.description: The destination to which the connection should be forwarded to.

destination.description: Destination uniquely identifies the instances of a service to which the request/connection should be forwarded to.

host.description: The name of a service from the service registry.

port.description: Specifies the port on the host that is being addressed.

subset.description: The name of a subset within the service.

weight.description: Weight specifies the relative proportion of traffic to be forwarded to the destination.

conditions.description: Current service state of the resource.

lastProbeTime.description: Last time we probed the condition.

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

observedGeneration.description: Resource Generation to which the Condition refers.

reason.description: Unique, one-word, CamelCase reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status is the status of the condition.

type.description: Type is the type of the condition.

validationMessages.description: Includes any errors or warnings detected by Istio's analyzers.

documentationUrl.description: A url pointing to the Istio documentation for this specific error type.

level.description:
Represents how severe a message is.

Valid Options: UNKNOWN, ERROR, WARNING, INFO

code.description: A 7 character code matching `^IST[0-9]{4}$` intended to uniquely identify the message type.

name.description: A human-readable name for the message type.
